command.description: The command to run inside the snap when the app is invoked.
command.title: Command

autostart.description: The desktop file used to start an app when the desktop environment starts.
autostart.title: Autostart

common-id.description: The identifier to a desktop ID within an external appstream file.
common-id.title: Common-Id

bus-name.description: The bus name that the application or service exposes through D-Bus.
bus-name.title: Bus-Name

desktop.description: The desktop file used to start an app.
desktop.title: Desktop

completer.description: The name of the bash completion script for the app.
completer.title: Completer

stop-command.description: The command to run to stop the service.
stop-command.title: Stop-Command

post-stop-command.description: The command to run after the service is stopped.
post-stop-command.title: Post-Stop-Command

start-timeout.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for the service to start.
start-timeout.title: Start-Timeout

stop-timeout.description: The maximum amount of time to wait for the service to stop.
stop-timeout.title: Stop-Timeout

watchdog-timeout.description: The maximum amount of time the service can run without sending a heartbeat to the watchdog.
watchdog-timeout.title: Watchdog-Timeout

reload-command.description: The command to run to restart the service.
reload-command.title: Reload-Command

restart-delay.description: The time to wait between service restarts.
restart-delay.title: Restart-Delay

timer.description: The time or schedule to run a service.
timer.title: Timer

daemon.description: Configures the app as a service, and sets its runtime and notification behavior.
daemon.title: Daemon

after.description: The ordered list of apps that the service runs after it launches.
after.title: After

before.description: The ordered list of apps that the service runs before it launches.
before.title: Before

refresh-mode.description: Determines how the service should restart when the snap refreshes.
refresh-mode.title: Refresh-Mode

stop-mode.description: The signal to send when stopping the service.
stop-mode.title: Stop-Mode

restart-condition.description: The conditions that cause the service to restart.
restart-condition.title: Restart-Condition

install-mode.description: Whether snapd can automatically start the service when the snap is installed.
install-mode.title: Install-Mode

slots.description: The list of slots that the app provides.
slots.title: Slots

plugs.description: The interfaces that the app can connect to.
plugs.title: Plugs

aliases.description: The aliases that can be used to run the app.
aliases.title: Aliases

command-chain.description: The ordered list of commands to run before the app's command runs.
command-chain.title: Command-Chain

sockets.description: The sockets used to activate an app.
sockets.title: Sockets

daemon-scope.description: Determines whether the service is run on a system or user instance of systemd.
daemon-scope.title: Daemon-Scope

activates-on.description: The slots exposed by the snap to activate the service with D-Bus.
activates-on.title: Activates-On

passthrough.description: The attributes to pass to the snap's metadata file for the app.
passthrough.title: Passthrough

extensions.description: The extensions to add to the project.
extensions.title: Extensions

build-on.description: The architectures on which the snap can be built.
build-on.title: Build-On

build-for.description: The single element list containing the architecture where the snap can be run
build-for.title: Build-For

name.title: Name

Lint.description:
Linter configuration.

:ivar ignore: A list describing which files should have issues ignored for given linters.
    The items in the list can be either:
    - a string, which must be the name of one of the known linters (see below). All issues
      from this linter will be ignored.
    - a dict containing exactly one key, which must be the name of one of the known linters.
        The value is then a list of strings corresponding to the filenames/patterns that
        should be ignored for that linter.
    The "known" linter names are the keys in :ref:`LINTERS`

ignore.description: Linters or files to skip when linting.
ignore.title: Ignore

Lint.title: Lint

Required if one of ``version``, ``summary``, or ``description`` isn't set.
adopt-info.title: Adopt-Info

parts.description: The self-contained software pieces needed to create the final artifact.
parts.title: Parts

package-repositories.description: The package repositories to use for build and stage packages.
package-repositories.title: Package-Repositories

compression.description: Specifies the algorithm that compresses the snap.
compression.title: Compression

website.description: The links to the original software's web pages.
website.title: Website

icon.description: The path to the snap's icon.
icon.title: Icon

confinement.description: The amount of isolation the snap has from the host system.
confinement.title: Confinement

layout.description: The file layouts in the execution environment.
layout.title: Layout

grade.description: The quality grade of the snap.
grade.title: Grade

architectures.description: The architecture sets where the snap can be built and where the resulting snap can run.
architectures.title: Architectures

assumes.description: The minimum version of snapd and its features that the snap requires from the host.
assumes.title: Assumes

passthrough.description: The attributes to pass to the snap's metadata file.
passthrough.title: Passthrough

apps.description: The map of app names representing entry points to run for the snap.
apps.title: Apps

epoch.description: The epoch associated with this version of the snap.
epoch.title: Epoch

system-usernames.description: The system usernames that the snap can use to run daemons and services.
system-usernames.title: System-Usernames

build-packages.description: The list of packages to install when building a snap.
build-packages.title: Build-Packages

build-snaps.description: The snaps to install when building a snap.
build-snaps.title: Build-Snaps

ua-services.description: The Ubuntu Pro (formerly Ubuntu Advantage) services to enable when building the snap.
ua-services.title: Ua-Services

provenance.description: The primary-key header for snaps signed by third parties.
provenance.title: Provenance

components.description: Declares the components to build in conjunction with the snap.
components.title: Components

_BaselessProject.title: _BaselessProject
